summary: This is an affidavit from a security consultant detailing his professional background, his security work for Ghislaine Maxwell from July 2019 until her arrest, the security threats she faced, and the circumstances of her arrest on July 2, 2020. The consultant also states his company will post a $1 million bond for her bail application.

persons.name: Security Consultant
persons.context: The author of the affidavit, a former UK Special Forces member and security company owner, who provided security services for Ghislaine Maxwell from July 2019 until her arrest and whose company is posting a bond for her bail.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the security consultant's protection services, who faced death threats and press harassment, was arrested on July 2, 2020, and is the subject of a renewed bail application.

persons.name: Jeffery Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the person with whom Ghislaine Maxwell had a relationship approximately 20 years prior, which was connected to death threats she received.

persons.name: Princess Diana
persons.context: Cited as an example of a life lost due to press intrusion, used to justify the need for meticulous security planning for Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: The Security Consultant and his company were contracted to provide security services and close protection for Ghislaine Maxwell.
The document states Maxwell had a relationship with Epstein approximately 20 years prior, which was connected to death threats she received.
The Security Consultant's company is posting a $1 million bond in support of Maxwell's bail application, a step he states he has never taken for a client before.

events.title: Announcement of Epstein's Death
events.description: The announcement of Jeffrey Epstein's death, after which the security consultant's risk assessment showed Ghislaine Maxwell was at substantial risk.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: FBI agents arrested Ghislaine Maxwell at a residence in Bradford, New Hampshire, in the morning. Her security consultant was present and detained.

events.title: Affidavit Signed
events.description: The security consultant signed this affidavit in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's renewed bail application.

keyFacts: A security consultant with UK Special Forces background provided protection for Ghislaine Maxwell from July 2019 until her arrest on July 2, 2020.
Maxwell faced death threats connected to her past relationship with Jeffrey Epstein and aggressive harassment from the press.
The consultant's operative was present during Maxwell's arrest by FBI agents at a residence in Bradford, New Hampshire.
The consultant's company is posting a $1 million bond for Maxwell's bail application, a first for the consultant.
The arrest occurred after a security protocol was activated due to a helicopter and vehicles approaching the property, initially mistaken for press.
